video:video.video:title: Windows Server System Insights steers admins from trouble
video:video.video:description: The predictive analytics feature in Windows Server 2019 gives administrators a heads-up to potential problems to avoid the scrambling when help desk tickets start to pile up.

video:video.video:title: Use a Windows Server 2019 domain controller or go to Azure?
video:video.video:description: Administrators must dig into the details to see if a swap from on-premises Active Directory to the Azure equivalent makes sense for their organization.

video:video.video:title: Update makes Storage Migration Service more cloud-friendly
video:video.video:description: The latest version of the Windows Admin Center comes with a refinement to one of its tools to make moving a file server to Azure less of a challenge.

video:video.video:title: Deploy and configure WSUS 2019 for Windows patching needs
video:video.video:description: You can update your Microsoft software with a few tools, but Windows Server Update Services is the go-to for many administrators who want a reliable patch deployment platform.

video:video.video:title: How to install the Windows Server 2019 VPN
video:video.video:description: A VPN prevents unauthorized users from gaining access to critical resources in your organization. This tutorial covers the deployment on Windows Server 2019.

video:video.video:title: How to install and test Windows Server 2019 IIS
video:video.video:description: The installation process for the Windows Server 2019 IIS role is fairly straightforward. This tutorial explains how to stand up the web server and check its ports and bindings.

video:video.video:title: Working with the VSCode PowerShell extension
video:video.video:description: PowerShell ISE remains one of the more popular PowerShell editors, but admins should explore the capabilities of VSCode if they want to manage more than just Windows systems.

video:video.video:title: Office 365 labels help keep content under control
video:video.video:description: Labels in Office 365 take data governance tasks out of the users' hands through the automatic designation of policies to meet regulations or internal procedures.

video:video.video:title: Construct a chain of commands with the PowerShell pipeline
video:video.video:description: The pipeline in PowerShell connects multiple cmdlets to assemble complex commands to give administrators advanced management control over their systems.
